Contributing Getting Started

Anybody is welcome to submit pull requests to Grimwire, but changes will undergo careful review before merging. To help this process and increase the odds of merging, please follow this process:

Submitting a Pull Request

  • File an issue in the GitHub Issue Tracker for Grimwire. Include a detailed description of the bug/improvement and, if waiting for commentary, tag your question with "@pfraze". (Some issues may be moved to the Local API tracker - if you're unsure which to use, default to Grimwire's.)
  • Write a fix in your fork of the repository, then submit the branch as a pull request. Be certain to refer to the issue number in the pull request.
  • If some time passes without a response, please comment on the issue with a "@pfraze" tag to get our attention.

Bugfixes and trivial changes are the most likely to be merged quickly. If you have bigger needs or want to suggest a change, start a thread on the Grimwire Google Group and discuss it with the core developers first.
